text: So im having issues using fontAwesome's JS embed code and `<span class="fa fa-iconName"></span>` inside of a rich text editor's view source option
it looks like it simply strips out the whole span tag
looks like i need to add `&nbsp;` between the tag so it doesnt strip it

Wondering if anyone is using any special methodology for managing / re-using code across clients or if everything is a custom job :wink: I'm thinking about all the unique macros / custom widgets / snippets I've created and used and wanted to organize them for re-use / adaptation later

Not sure if you know this, but you can transfer templates from one portal to another. We use a base template for simple websites and then also have a git repo for modules/snippets that are easier to copy/paste than to transfer everything. IE Testimonial sliders etc...

Oh yeah, <@U2H1Q3F8R> I've been doing this a bunch (I had actually forgotten about it since it's been a while) - I was just curious if people are keeping a local repository of all code in their own portal, using a separate code manager, or something different.
Has anyone had any experience doing Smart Content in global footers/headers on the HubSpot COS?
Or using smart content in a custom module?
